meanings.definition: To steer a vehicle in a way that causes the rear wheels to lose traction and the vehicle to turn more sharply than intended.
meanings.sent1: The car started to oversteer when the driver turned too quickly on the wet road.
meanings.sent2: Drivers should be careful not to oversteer when navigating sharp corners.
meanings.sent3: The oversteering car looked like it was dancing on the slippery road.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to oversteer through the obstacle course was as graceful as a swan gliding on water.
meanings.sent5: The instructor demonstrated how to oversteer safely on the closed track.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a vehicle to oversteer.
meanings.sent1: The sports car's oversteer made it challenging to control on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: Mechanics often adjust suspension settings to reduce oversteer in racing cars.
meanings.sent3: The oversteer of the old truck always caught the driver off guard.
meanings.sent4: The oversteer of the bus was like a wild horse trying to break free from its reins.
meanings.sent5: The driver felt the oversteer of the car as it slid sideways on the gravel road.
